cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles E of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then forecast to turn north-northwest and ride just offshore the Florida east coast before aiming for the South-Carolina/North-Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL (includes Jacksonville area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Northeast Florida (Storm Surge Watch ends at Ponte Vedra Beach)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida east coast through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible Sunday evening through early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Possible inundation 2–4 ft above ground along beaches and St. Johns River mouth at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain expected, locally higher amounts possible in squalls
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; brief coastal flooding along the St. Johns River during high tides
